channel.title: Le gouvernement luxembourgeois - Toutes les actualités
channel.description: Suivez les dernières informations Le gouvernement luxembourgeois

image.title: Le gouvernement luxembourgeois - Toutes les actualités
image.description: Suivez les dernières informations Le gouvernement luxembourgeois

item.title: International Animal Rights Day: The Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Viticulture relaunches its awareness campaign "Animals Aren't Fashion Accessories"
item.description: International Animal Rights Day is celebrated every year on 10 December. In Luxembourg, all animals, whether domestic, livestock or wild, are recognised as sentient beings in their own right, with a right to well-being, dignity and safety, as set out in the Animal Protection Act 2018.

item.title: Fifth International Day of Awareness of Food Loss and Waste: A collective responsibility!
item.description: The International Day of Awareness of Food Loss and Waste, introduced in 2020 by the United Nations (UN), is an opportunity to recall, every 29 September, that the fight against food waste is a lever for action against climate change.

item.title: Jobday: The Institut Viti-Vinicole and ADEM relaunch seasonal recruitment for the 2024 grape harvest
item.description: The National Employment Agency (ADEM) and the Wine Institute (Institut viti-vinicole - IVV) have announced the renewal of their collaboration in the recruitment of seasonal workers for work in the vineyards and for the 2024 harvest along the Luxembourg wine route.

item.title: Martine Hansen awards prizes for sustainable food system solutions
item.description: In the context of the "NoA" project call, Infino asbl rewards 7 innovative student projects.

item.title: Martine Hansen at the Agriculture and Fisheries Council in Brussels
item.description: Martine Hansen, Minister for Agriculture, Food and Viticulture, attended the Agriculture and Fisheries Council meeting in Brussels on Monday 27 May 2024.

item.title: Call to combat the proliferation of stray cats
item.description: In consultation with the Lëtzebuerger Déiereschutzliga ASBL, Martine Hansen, Minister for Agriculture, Food and Viticulture, is calling on cat owners to help combat the proliferation of stray cats.

item.title: Antigaspi'' campaign: the Antigaspi exhibition, a tool for raising awareness of food waste
item.description: One of the priorities of the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Viticulture is to raise public awareness of the problem of food waste and provide information on the best ways to reduce food waste.

item.title: Martine Hansen échange avec les représentants du secteur bio luxembourgeois
item.description: Martine Hansen, ministre de l'Agriculture, de l'Alimentation et de la Viticulture, a reçu une délégation des acteurs du secteur bio luxembourgeois ce lundi 11 mars 2024.

item.title: Ministers Martine Hansen and Serge Wilmes at the first 'Landwirtschaftsdësch': Working together to find solutions to current problems and future challenges
item.description: At a recent meeting between Ministers Luc Frieden, Martine Hansen and Serge Wilmes and representatives of Luxembourg's agricultural sector, the government underlined the importance it attaches to the concerns of the agricultural, horticultural and wine-growing sectors.

item.title: Martine Hansen au Conseil "Agriculture et Pêche": Regagner la confiance des agriculteurs et les rapprocher des décisions politiques
item.description: Martine Hansen, ministre de l'Agriculture, de l'Alimentation et de la Viticulture a participé au Conseil "Agriculture et Pêche" ce mardi, 23 janvier 2024 à Bruxelles.

item.title: Martine Hansen meets representatives of Baueren-Allianz
item.description: Martine Hansen, Minister of Agriculture, Food and Viticulture, met representatives of the Baueren-Allianz on Monday 22 January 2024 for a concrete and constructive exchange of views.

item.title: Martine Hansen at the Global Forum for Food and Agriculture to discuss the future of food systems
item.description: On 20 January, Minister Martine Hansen represented Luxembourg at the 16th Conference of Agriculture Ministers in Berlin, the culmination of the Global Forum for Food and Agriculture (GFFA), which brought together more than 80 agriculture ministers under the auspices of the German Federal Minister for Food and Agriculture, Cem Özdemir.

item.title: Martine Hansen annonce l'institutionnalisation du "Landwirtschaftsdësch" aux représentants de la Chambre d'agriculture
item.description: Martine Hansen, la nouvelle ministre de l'Agriculture, de l'Alimentation et de la Viticulture, a rencontré aujourd'hui les représentants de la Chambre d'agriculture pour une première fois.

item.title: Raising awareness of the risk of vegetation and forest fires
item.description: Within the frame of the national platform for disaster risk reduction, led by the Ministry of Home Affairs, the working group on "Vegetation and Forest Fires", composed of experts from the relevant authorities, has prepared advice on how to behave during the vegetation and forest fire season.

item.title: Certains produits phytopharmaceutiques interdits à partir du 1er janvier 2024
item.description: Le ministre de l'Agriculture, de la Viticulture et du Développement rural, Claude Haagen, annonce qu'à partir du 1er janvier 2024, la vente au grand public de certains herbicides, insecticides, anti-limaces et fongicides sera interdite.
